sub_topic: Finding eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix using power iteration method
message_1:
What are the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the following matrix using the power iteration method: 

$$ A = \begin{bmatrix} 0.8 & 0.3 & 0.4 \\ 0.3 & 0.2 & 0.7 \\ 0.4 & 0.7 & 0.5 \end{bmatrix} $$ 

Use an initial guess of $\vec{x_0} = [1 \ 1 \ 1]^\mathrm{T}$ and perform the power iteration for at least 5 iterations or until the output converges within a tolerance of $10^{-6}$.
message_2:
To find the eigenvalues and eigenvectors using the power iteration method, we will perform the following steps:

1. Start with an initial guess $\vec{x_0} = [1 \ 1 \ 1]^\mathrm{T}$.
2. Calculate the product of the matrix A and the current guess $\vec{x_i}$: $\vec{x_{i+1}} = A\vec{x_i}$.
3. Normalize the resulting vector $\vec{x_{i+1}}$.
4. Repeat steps 2 and 3 until the output converges within a tolerance of $10^{-6}$ or for at least 5 iterations.

Let's perform the power iteration:

Iteration 1:
$$\vec{x_1} = A\vec{x_0} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.8 & 0.3 & 0.4 \\ 0.3 & 0.2 & 0.7 \\ 0.4 & 0.7 & 0.5 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1.5 \\ 1.2 \\ 1.6 \end{bmatrix}$$
Normalize $\vec{x_1}$:
$$\vec{x_1} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{1.5^2 + 1.2^2 + 1.6^2}} \begin{bmatrix} 1.5 \\ 1.2 \\ 1.6 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.462 \\ 0.615 \end{bmatrix}$$

Iteration 2:
$$\vec{x_2} = A\vec{x_1} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.8 & 0.3 & 0.4 \\ 0.3 & 0.2 & 0.7 \\ 0.4 & 0.7 & 0.5 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.462 \\ 0.615 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.923 \\ 0.615 \\ 1.077 \end{bmatrix}$$
Normalize $\vec{x_2}$:
$$\vec{x_2} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{0.923^2 + 0.615^2 + 1.077^2}} \begin{bmatrix} 0.923 \\ 0.615 \\ 1.077 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix}$$

Iteration 3:
$$\vec{x_3} = A\vec{x_2} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.8 & 0.3 & 0.4 \\ 0.3 & 0.2 & 0.7 \\ 0.4 & 0.7 & 0.5 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.923 \\ 0.615 \\ 1.077 \end{bmatrix}$$
Normalize $\vec{x_3}$:
$$\vec{x_3} = \frac{1}{\sqrt{0.923^2 + 0.615^2 + 1.077^2}} \begin{bmatrix} 0.923 \\ 0.615 \\ 1.077 \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix}$$

Since $\vec{x_3}$ and $\vec{x_2}$ are the same within the given tolerance, we can stop the iteration process. The dominant eigenvector is $\vec{x_3} = \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix}$.

Now, to find the corresponding eigenvalue, we can use the Rayleigh quotient:
$$\lambda = \frac{\vec{x_3}^T A \vec{x_3}}{\vec{x_3}^T \vec{x_3}}$$

$$\lambda = \frac{\begin{bmatrix} 0.577 & 0.385 & 0.673 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 0.8 & 0.3 & 0.4 \\ 0.3 & 0.2 & 0.7 \\ 0.4 & 0.7 & 0.5 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix}}{\begin{bmatrix} 0.577 & 0.385 & 0.673 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix}}$$

$$\lambda \approx 1.3$$

So, the dominant eigenvalue is approximately 1.3, and the corresponding eigenvector is $\begin{bmatrix} 0.577 \\ 0.385 \\ 0.673 \end{bmatrix}$.
